channel.title: Hello :) few questions here
channel.description:
I have a few questions so I guess i'll just post thems here and see if someone can answer me :P would be nice hehe
first, I would like to know what should I use as a good base? I want one that is easy to code (I'm currently using PI) and I would like to use 474 maps and character model and add 600+ gfx anims and items? is that possible? if so let me know x) thank you in advance
Poutine.

item.title: Hello :) few questions here
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Cres, where did you get this code from a PI??

        public int playerAttack = 0;
        public int playerDefence = 1;
        public int playerStrength = 2;
        public int playerHitpoints = 3;
        public int playerRanged = 4;
        public int playerPrayer = 5;
        public int playerMagic = 6;
        public int playerCooking = 7;
        public int playerWoodcutting = 8;
        public int playerFletching = 9;
        public int playerFishing = 10;
        public int playerFiremaking = 11;
        public int playerCrafting = 12;
        public int playerSmithing = 13;
        public int playerMining = 14;
        public int playerHerblore = 15;
        public int playerAgility = 16;
        public int playerThieving = 17;
        public int playerSlayer = 18;
        public int playerFarming = 19;
        public int playerRunecrafting = 20;

I have never seen that, ever.
I’ve always seen:
public int[] playerLevel = new int[25];

Read full topic

item.title: Hello :) few questions here
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

PI:

public int playerAttack = 0; public int playerDefence = 1; public int playerStrength = 2; public int playerHitpoints = 3; public int playerRanged = 4; public int playerPrayer = 5; public int playerMagic = 6; public int playerCooking = 7; public int playerWoodcutting = 8; public int playerFletching = 9; public int playerFishing = 10; public int playerFiremaking = 11; public int playerCrafting = 12; public int playerSmithing = 13; public int playerMining = 14; public int playerHerblore = 15; public int playerAgility = 16; public int playerThieving = 17; public int playerSlayer = 18; public int playerFarming = 19; public int playerRunecrafting = 20;

Correct naming conventions:

public static final int ATTACK = 0; public static final int DEFENCE = 1; public static final int STRENGTH = 2; public static final int HITPOINTS = 3; public static final int RANGED = 4; public static final int PRAYER = 5; public static final int MAGIC = 6; public static final int COOKING = 7; public static final int WOODCUTTING = 8; public static final int FLETCHING = 9; public static final int FISHING = 10; public static final int FIREMAKING = 11; public static final int CRAFTING = 12; public static final int SMITHING = 13; public static final int MINING = 14; public static final int HERBLORE = 15; public static final int AGILITY = 16; public static final int THIEVING = 17; public static final int SLAYER = 18; public static final int FARMING = 19; public static final int RUNECRAFTING = 20;
Read more here: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/codeconv-138413.html

Every traditional server has its tradeoff, you know. PI is inefficient and the developper overlooked some very basic things in the design. Delta is like… unfinished as fuck. Never tried Czar or Allstar, though I’m sure they’re much like Delta. Hyperion is stable and efficient but just… not user-friendly.
For these reasons, I urge you to master Java and make your own server framework.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello :) few questions here
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:9, topic:528007”][quote author=Cres link=topic=646755.msg4350654#msg4350654 date=1376594287]

Stick with PI or Delta

So he can learn horrible naming + bad conventions?

May have overlooked that. Allright, read Hyperion’s code to see what we mean by ‘proper conventions’ but stick with PI/Delta for its simplicity.
Move to Hyperion or your own framework once you’re feeling confident enough with Java.
[/quote]
Or even Apollo. But w/e. Alot of us made the bad choice of plainly learning from allstar, so yeah, we don’t want you to do that.

Thanks for correcting yourself Cres.[/quote]implying czar can’t be made good…

Read full topic

Stick with PI or Delta for now, move onto Hyperion or make your own server once you’ve learned enough Java
